definitions: To allow someone to stay in one's home; to provide shelter.
examples: They decided to take me in after I lost my apartment.
Don't let that salesman take me in with his smooth talk.
It took me a while to take me in all the details of the plan.
The new policy will take me in a wider range of cases.
The tailor will need to take me in the waist of these pants.
pastTenses: took me in, taken me in
